title: How to Clean Vomit from a Mattress

steps.title: Scrape the vomit off the bed.
steps.content: Scrape the vomit off the bed. The first step is to scrape any solids off of the surface of the bed. “Using a disposable item such as a paper plate, scrape the vomit into a plastic bag and immediately dispose of the potential biohazard properly,” says Sears. [1] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. Place the paper plate in the plastic bag with the vomit too, then tie it up and throw it into the trash. [2] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source It’s important to remove any solids from your sheets and bedding first because they can clog your washing machine’s drain and cause unpleasant odors. Sears also says that it's also a good idea to put on disposable gloves before you start cleaning to protect you from germs. [3] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. Disposable gloves are better than reusable ones, so you don’t have to worry about cleaning the vomit off of the gloves afterwards, Sears explains. [4] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019.

steps.title: Remove the sheets and comforter and wash them thoroughly.
steps.content: Remove the sheets and comforter and wash them thoroughly. If the bedding is still on your bed, remove it before moving on to cleaning the mattress. Strip the sheets, comforter, mattress pad, and any other items from the bed, and wash them in the washing machine. [5] X Research source Wash the bedding on the highest temperature setting that is available on the washer to help kill any lingering germs. [6] X Research source If you’d like, you can also add a commercial laundry sanitizer when you wash your bedding. These products kill germs and bacteria, and they’re also safe to use on most fabrics and colors. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Soak up the remaining liquid from the mattress with a towel or rag.
steps.content: Soak up the remaining liquid from the mattress with a towel or rag. Once you've removed the sheets from the bed, use paper towels to soak up any liquid from the vomit that may have reached the mattress. Avoid rubbing the stained area, though. Instead, blot it to help remove the liquid without spreading it around or pushing it deeper into the mattress. [8] X Research source If you don’t want to use paper towels, you can also use a dry cloth or rag, but it's a good idea to use an old one, since you may want to throw it out when you're done.

steps.title: Mix equal parts water and white vinegar.
steps.content: Mix equal parts water and white vinegar. Once you’ve removed solids and excess moisture, it’s time to spot-clean any stain that’s left over on the mattress. Combine 1 cup (237 ml) warm water and 1 cup (237 ml) of white vinegar in a spray bottle and shake it up. [9] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source For extra cleaning power, you can also mix in 1 tsp (5 ml) of liquid dish soap. Dish soap has impressive grease-cutting qualities, so it can break down vomit stains very well. There are several different cleaning agents that work on vomit stains, so here are a few other options to try out if you don’t want to use the above mixture: Enzyme cleaner: Enzyme cleaners are formulated to break down biological matter, so they're great for cleaning up vomit, blood, or urine. [10] X Research source These cleaners may have slightly different instructions, so follow the directions listed on the specific product you buy. Hydrogen peroxide Hydrogen peroxide has antibacterial and antiviral properties, as well as a bleaching effect, which makes it a good choice for vomit stains. To use it, simply add some hydrogen peroxide to a spray bottle, spray the area until it’s damp but not soaked, then let it dry. [11] X Research source Laundry detergent: You can also use laundry detergent to remove a vomit stain, as long as it’s bleach-free (bleach may harm the mattress fibers). [12] X Research source Add 1 part white vinegar with 2 parts water and a splash of laundry detergent to a spray bottle, then spray the stain with this solution. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Spray the mixture on the stain and blot the area well.
steps.content: Spray the mixture on the stain and blot the area well. After you've prepared the vinegar mixture, apply it to the stains on the mattress. Don't oversaturate the mattress; spray the stained area until it is just damp. Next, blot the mattress with a clean rag or paper towel to lift the stain. [14] X Trustworthy Source HealthyChildren.org Health information from the American Academy of Pediatrics. Go to source

steps.title: Repeat the process until the stain is gone.
steps.content: Repeat the process until the stain is gone. Depending on the stain, one application of the vinegar solution may not be enough to remove it completely. Apply the cleaning solution to the mattress and blot it as many times as necessary to completely remove the vomit stain. [15] X Research source Make sure to have plenty of clean towels on hand for the blotting. You don't want to blot the mattress over and over with the same towel because you can wind up spreading the stain.

steps.title: Apply baking soda to the affected area.
steps.content: Apply baking soda to the affected area. Once you’ve spot-treated the stain with your cleaning solution, sprinkle some baking soda over the area. [16] X Research source The baking soda will help absorb any remaining liquid and remove the lingering odor, explains Sears. [17] X Expert Source James Sears House Cleaning Professional Expert Interview. 28 August 2019. For even more odor-fighting powder, try mixing a drop or two of the essential oil of your choice into the baking soda before sprinkling it over the area. The pleasant scent of the oil will help combat any lingering smells from the vomit.

steps.title: Allow the baking soda to sit overnight.
steps.content: Allow the baking soda to sit overnight. Once you've spread the baking soda on the stained section of the mattress, it needs time to absorb any leftover liquid and odor. Let the baking soda sit on the mattress overnight or for at least 8 hours. [18] X Research source If you or someone else needs to sleep on the bed, you can lay a clean towel over the baking soda on the mattress so you can place sheets over it.

steps.title: In the morning, vacuum up the baking soda.
steps.content: In the morning, vacuum up the baking soda. After the baking soda has sat on the mattress overnight, use a vacuum cleaner to remove the residue. Be sure to empty the vacuum and wash the canister or change the bag afterward to get rid of any bacteria from the vomit. [19] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source Using the vacuum's hose attachment is the best bet to ensure that you remove all of the baking soda residue. If you don't have a vacuum cleaner, you can sweep the baking soda residue into a garbage can or bag.

steps.title: Apply rubbing alcohol to kill any lingering germs (optional).
steps.content: Apply rubbing alcohol to kill any lingering germs (optional). Even after you fully clean the mattress, germs can still be left behind after someone vomits. If you’re still worried after one round of cleaning, spray the affected area lightly with rubbing alcohol to knock out any leftover bacteria. [20] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Allow the mattress to dry completely.
steps.content: Allow the mattress to dry completely. After you've applied the rubbing alcohol, allow the mattress to dry completely. It should take about 6 hours, but it's a good idea to let it air dry overnight to be certain it's dry. [21] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source You can help the drying process by turning on an overhead fan, aiming a freestanding fan at the mattress, or opening a window near the bed. [22] X Research source Be sure to keep children and pets away from the mattress until the alcohol is dry.

steps.title: Consider purchasing a mattress protector.
steps.content: Consider purchasing a mattress protector. A mattress protector is a cover you can put over your mattress to protect it from stains, dirt, moisture, and allergens. [23] X Research source If you happen to get sick and vomit on your bed, the mattress protector will keep the vomit from reaching the surface of the mattress. In that case, all you’d have to do is remove your bedding and the mattress protector and wash them in the washing machine.

steps.title: There are a few steps you can take to avoid vomiting on your bed.
steps.content: There are a few steps you can take to avoid vomiting on your bed. If you’re dealing with a stomach bug or food poisoning, it can be a hassle to clean up vomit from your bedding and mattress if you happen to vomit during the night. Here are some tips to help soothe nausea when you’re trying to fall asleep: Lie down in a slightly propped-up position. You can either use a wedge pillow or just add another pillow or two to your normal set-up in order to elevate your head and upper body. Drink a very small amount of a sweet liquid, like soda or apple juice. [24] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Have a small cup of ginger or peppermint tea. [25] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Suck on a hard candy or popsicle. Eat a small amount of a bland food, like saltine crackers, to settle your stomach. Just in case, lay a towel under yourself before going to sleep, and keep a bucket lined with a plastic bag next to your bed to vomit into if necessary.
